item.title: Full Webclient Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Kollidierende Kolli`
item.description:
@Kollidierende wrote:

If people leech this I will Delete it. Also, this is somewhat Anti-Noob… There are no errors. I just made it hard to find stuff in some parts.

Purpose: To Create a webclient

Difficulty: 6/10

Assumed Knowledge: Java Fundamentals?

Client Base: All

Classes Modified: Client.java, Class 30 Sub 2 Sub 1 Sub 1

Procedure

[center]Client.java[/center]
Step 1: [i]Go into your client folder and open up client.java. Search for void int(). Once there repalce the whole void with this public final void init() { try { anInt957 = 0; anInt958 = 0; method52(true); aBoolean959 = true; signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); setserver(""); method2(503, false, 765); } catch (Exception exception) { return; } }
Step 2: [i]Search for private final void method28 Once you have found it replace the whole thing with private final void method28(String s) { System.out.println(s); }

Step 3: [i]Search for public final URL getCodeBase() Replace the whole thing with public final URL getCodeBase(){ try { return new URL("http://"+server+":" + (80 + anInt958)); } catch(Exception _ex) { } return super.getCodeBase(); }

Step 4: [i]Search for public static void setserver And Replace it with public static void setserver(String s) { server = s; }

Step 5: [i] Find setserver(args[0],args[1],args[2]); And replace it with setserver(args[0]);

[center]Other[/center]

Step 1: [i]Open up Class 30 sub 2 sub 1 sub 1 and import this package java.net.URL;

Step 2: [i]Find where your picture loads from. Make it look like this Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("WEBSITEWHEREPCILOADSFROM")); Upload a picture, 766X503, to a website and place the link to the picture “WEBSITEWHEREPCILOADSFROM” There.

Step 3: [i] Open up your META-INF Folder and delete everything. Make a .txt file in the META-INF Folder and place this inside of it Manifest-Version: 1.0 Created-By: 1.5.0_04 (Sun Microsystems Inc.) Main-Class: client
Then Click File -> Save as -> MANIFEST.MF -> All Files.

Step 4: [i] Make your client load the cache from Mopars. Follow my Making a JAR And Signing a JAR Tutorial(Will be made later)

Step 5: [i] Upload the JAR to your webpage. Make a file called index.html and place this in it [code]

Servername Webclient [/code] If everything has been completed right you now have a working webclient that connects to servers!

Credits: Newty, Kolli`

Read full topic
